titleStmt.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard, February 10, 1887

bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Mr. S. S. Sevier
To the Secretary of State.
Death of Miss Enice Knapp an American citizen.
Death of Miss Knapp a missionary of the Free Methodist Church–inventory of her personal property–her stated residence.

Hon. T. F. Bayard
Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

It becomes my painful duty to inform you that a missionary of the Free Methodist Church by the name of Miss Enice Knapp who had been only two months within the bounds of this Consulate working earnestly to spread the gospel of
of Jesus Christ in this land died on the 2nd of Feb'y from the contagion fever of this country. Inventory of her personal property has been taken and will be disposed off just as soon as I can obtain the right address of her relatives. The place of her birth is unknown to me. I am told by a distant friend that Mrs. Alford Wilkins #26 W. 38th Street New York City is her nearest known relative. The expenses of her funeral
funeral were settled without auctioning any of her effects according to the Consular Regulations. In inclose an inventory of her effects.

I have the honor to be
Sir
Your obedient servant
Sam'l S. Sevier
Acting U.S. Consul Gen.
div1.fw:
Hon. T. F. Bayard
Secretary of State
Washington D.C.
div1.p: 1. Inventory of the effects of Miss Knapp.

1 Piece of Goods Patch work for two quilts not joined
Three quilt tops joined
1 Piece of Cashmere
1 Pillow Tick
10 Pieces of Cloth
2 Pieces of Flannel Underwear
5 Night Dresses
10 Pieces of Underwear
3 White Skirts
8 Aprons
4 Waists
1 Tidy
6 Pair of Stockings
1 Missionary Egg with contents
1 White Marsailles Basque
2 Knit Undergarments
1 Velveteen cloak
2 Pillow Shams
6 Napkins
8 Handkerchiefs
5 Towels
12 Dresses
1 Pair of Rubbers
3 Pair of Shoes
2 Pair " Slippers
1 Shawl
1 Table Cloth
1 Water Proof Circular
2 Skirts
1 Quilted Quilt
1 Flannel Blanket
1 Pin cushion
26 Books and Albums
1 Silver Knife, Fork, & Napkin ring
1 China cup & Saucers
2 Picture Large size
1 Hat 2 Pictures, 1 Watch
1 Box with contents
1 Hand Satchel
1 Bag Trinkets
Number of Pictures
1 Parasol
1 Comb

Saml. S. Sevier
Acting U.S. Consul Gen.

Witnesses
Robt. L. Harris
J. O. Hines
